notesStmt.note: Defective at the beginning and at the end. Lacunae after folio 30, 32. Stained. Several leaves more or less damaged. Fading ink. Folio 4 and 5 partly illegible.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: A treatise on the laws of inheritance.

collation.p: Quires of originally 10 leaves each, now incomplete, marked with Arabic words on the left-hand upper corners of the first page (signatures mostly not preserved). The first two quires, together with the first leaf of the third quire, are missing. Folios 1-9 are the remaining 9 leaves of the third quire; folios 10-29 form two complete quires of 10 leaves each, marked on the left-hand upper corners of folios 10 and 20 respectively. Of the 6th quire only the first leaf and the last are preserved (folios 30-31); the same with the 7th quire. Folios 34-42 are the remaining leaves of the 8th quire.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: An Arabic hand of approximately 12th to 13th century.

binding.p: BM/BL in-house. Spine title: 'Karaite Polemic Treatise. Arabic. Brit. Mus. Oriental 2575.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Moses Wilhelm Shapira, (b. 1830, d. 1884), an antiquities dealer of Jerusalem: purchased by the British Library from him on 08 July 1882: inscribed, folio [46v].
